question_sentence: Which music legend turned 80 this week?
evidence: The Rolling Stones frontman celebrated his 80th birthday, on 26 July, with a star-studded party in London.

question_sentence: A swimwear trend known as what is taking hold on China’s beaches?
evidence: The face coverings are made of UV-resistant material and are designed to protect the wearer’s head, face and neck from sun exposure. For more odd and unexpected news, sign up to the Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Elon Musk has rebranded Twitter as what?
evidence: Musk announced this week that his company’s logo would change from the well-known blue bird to a black X. The billionaire’s controversial rebrand was widely ridiculed, with Forbes criticising him for “setting something on fire he paid $44 billion for”.

question_sentence: A large piece of what was discovered on a beach in Australia?
evidence: The unidentified debris is about the size of a small car and was found washed up on a remote beach some 150 miles north of Perth. Debris has been accruing in space around our planet since the first rocket launches in the late 1950s, with an estimated 36,500 objects greater than 10cm in near-Earth orbit, according to the European Space Agency (ESA).

question_sentence: What is the name of Joe Biden’s dog who is in the doghouse for repeatedly biting Secret Service agents?
evidence: According to a report from a conservative watchdog group, the US president’s dog has bitten Secret Service agents at least 10 times. The 22-month-old German Shepherd, a gift from Biden’s brother James, has been given “additional leashing protocols” following the incidents.

question_sentence: Gregg Wallace presented what alleged food innovation to combat the cost-of-living crisis in a newly aired TV satire?
evidence: In Channel 4’s “Gregg Wallace: The British Miracle Meat”, the MasterChef co-host claimed to be visiting a company that sold “engineered human meat” grown from slices of flesh surgically harvested from real people. The mockumentary has sparked complaints to Ofcom from viewers who believed Wallace really was promoting human steaks as a way to combat the cost-of-living crisis.

question_sentence: Which islands were at the centre of a diplomat spat this week between the EU and the UK?
evidence: A row broke out after the bloc referred to the Falkland Islands by the Argentine name, “Islas Malvinas”, in a communiqué signed in Brussels by 60 EU and Latin American nations. Rishi Sunak criticised the “regrettable choice of words”, which apparently endorsed Argentina’s claim to the archipelago, a British overseas territory.

question_sentence: Saudi Arabian football club Al Hilal put in a record £259 million transfer bid for which French player?
evidence: The 24-year-old striker’s club Paris Saint-Germain reportedly gave the Saudi Pro League side permission to speak to him after receiving the offer, but French media claimed Mbappé had refused to enter negotiations. His contract with the French side is due to expire next June.

question_sentence: The leader of which southeast Asian country is handing power to his eldest son after ruling for almost four decades?
evidence: Hun Sen, who has been Cambodia’s prime minister since 1985, announced his resignation days after his party won a virtually uncontested general election. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: How much did “Barbie” take at the global box office in the new film’s opening weekend?
evidence: Greta Gerwig’s “Barbie” claimed the top spot as the highest-grossing film of the year, raking in $162 million in the US and Canada alone.

question_sentence: Elon Musk replaced Twitter’s iconic bird logo with which letter?
evidence: Twitter is now X. Musk replaced Twitter’s globally recognized blue bird logo, which had been in use for more than a decade, as part of a radical rebranding.

question_sentence: Which state was sued by the Justice Department this week over the construction of a barrier along the US-Mexico border?
evidence: The Justice Department is suing to force Texas to remove floating barriers in the Rio Grande, which Gov. Greg Abbott has argued is intended to deter migrants from crossing into the state from Mexico.

question_sentence: Which movie currently holds the top spot on worldwide box office charts?
evidence: The “Barbie” movie, from director Greta Gerwig, scored the largest opening weekend of 2023, pulling in $155 million domestically over its opening weekend and $337 million globally.

question_sentence: Which grocery store chain recalled two types of cookies over concerns they may contain rocks?
evidence: Trader Joe’s announced a recall of two types of cookies, stating they may contain a foreign material — rocks.

question_sentence: Preparations are underway for the 2024 Olympic Games. Where will the Games be held?
evidence: Paris is preparing for the 2024 Olympic Games centered around the River Seine. The opening ceremony, which is traditionally held inside the host city’s Olympic stadium, will take place on the river, with at least 600,000 people expected to watch from the banks, according to organizers.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden’s dog, Commander, has been involved in several biting incidents, according to the US Secret Service. Which breed of dog is Commander?
evidence: The 22-month-old German Shepherd is receiving new training after White House personnel raised concerns about safety on the premises.

question_sentence: Three retired US military veterans testified Wednesday at a House hearing on unidentified anomalous phenomena — commonly known as UFOs. Around how many UFO cases is the government tracking?
evidence: The US government is tracking around 650 UFO cases. About half of those are being prioritized for “anomalous interesting value,” according to a Pentagon official.

question_sentence: At least 12 people were injured when a crane collapsed this week in which major city?
evidence: A crane collapsed Wednesday in New York City while the operator was lifting about 16 tons of concrete, officials said. Dramatic video showed flames and smoke rising from the crane before its boom fell, hitting a building across the street.

question_sentence: Which political figure froze for 30 seconds during a news conference this week, sparking renewed concerns about his health?
evidence: Senate GOP Leader Mitch McConnell told reporters he’s “fine” after freezing during a news conference on Wednesday. McConnell has declined to explain why he froze up, though an aide said he was feeling light-headed.

question_sentence: Which bizarre limited-edition flavor did Skittles debut this week?
evidence: Skittles’ newest flavor doesn’t taste like the rainbow — it tastes like mustard.
